section.p:
tearnaich ... beinn ... descends a mountain –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. Bha càrn chlach air mullach na beinne. Chuir Calum clach air a’ chàrn agus shuidh e ri taobh a’ chùirn a’ leigeil analach. [...] An ceann greise dh’éirich Calum ’na sheasamh agus thearnaich e a’ bheinn air a shocair.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. There was a cairn of stones on the top of the mountain. Calum put a stone onto the cairn and he sat down beside the cairn having a rest. [...] After a while Malcolm rose up and he descended the mountain leisurely. td. 146

mullach beinne a summit of a mountain –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. Bha càrn chlach air mullach na beinne.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. There was a cairn of stones on the top of the mountain. td. 146

cliathach beinne a side of a mountain.
Bha na caoraich shuas air cliathach na beinne.
The sheep were up on the side of the mountain. td. 21

caora air beinn a sheep on a mountain.
Bha na caoraich shuas air cliathach na beinne.
The sheep were up on the side of the mountain. td. 21

beinn ann am monadh a mountain on a moor –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. td. 146
